instruction:
You are a Rust expert. Fix the following code that has a compilation error.
Return ONLY the fixed Rust code without any explanation or markdown formatting.
input:
## Buggy Code:
```rust
fn find_item(v: &[i32], target: i32) -> Result<i32, &str> { v.iter().find(|&&x| x == target).copied() }
```

## Compiler Error:
mismatched types: use ok_or to convert Option to Result

## Fixed Code:
output: fn find_item(v: &[i32], target: i32) -> Result<i32, &str> { v.iter().find(|&&x| x == target).copied().ok_or("not found") }
